f.description: Shortcut for `format`. Specify `jpg`, `webp`, or `png` to convert formats. By default, no conversion will take place.

format.description: Specify `jpg`, `webp`, or `png` to convert formats. By default, no conversion will take place.

h.description: Shortcut for `height`. Scale image height (in pixels). Leave `width` blank to auto-scale. Specify `width` and `height` to ensure image is smaller than both.

height.description: Scale image height (in pixels). Leave `width` blank to auto-scale. Specify `width` and `height` to ensure image is smaller than both.

inline.description: Set to `?inline` or `?inline=true` to return SVG markup for SVG files, or base64 encoding for other files.

interpolation.description: When scaling, specify `'nearest'` for nearest-neighbor (pixel art), `'cubic'` for cubic interpolation, or `'lanczos2'` or `'lanczos3'` for [Lanczos][lanczos] with `a=2` or `a=3`. `'cubic'` is this loader’s default (because it’s what most are used to), as opposed to`'lanczos3'` which is sharp’s default (present for other loaders)

placeholder.description: Shortcut for `quality`. Specify a number, `1`–`100`, to reduce the image’s quality and filesize.

q.description: Shortcut for `quality`. Specify a number, `1`–`100`, to reduce the image’s quality and filesize.

quality.description: Specify a number, `1`–`100`, to reduce the image’s quality and filesize.

skip.description: Set to `?skip` or `?skip=true` to bypass resizing & optimization entirely. Useful for problem images.

w.description: Shortcut for `width`. Set image width (in pixels). Leave `height` blank to auto-scale. Specify `width` and `height` to ensure image is smaller than both.

width.description: Set image width (in pixels). Leave `height` blank to auto-scale. Specify `width` and `height` to ensure image is smaller than both.
